text: Oct 11, 2021 | 01:10 PM EDT DOUG KASS Why I Would Be Cautious on Banks Going Into Reporting Season Bank stocks are among the most favored value plays of many money managers and strategists based on the fact that the industry is a direct beneficiary of higher interest rates.

This is indeed true - as banks are balance sheet and income statement sensitive to a steepening yield curve and higher interest rates But for banks to profit after a great run since March, 2020, rising rates I believe - and it is the case historically - have to be accompanied

by an improving economy. And, unfortunately, as expressed in our opener, that is not the case: "Citigroup's Global Economic Surprise Index has turned negative and has fallen to levels historically associated with an economic slowdown/recession" @tomkeene @jimcramer
@cnbcfastmoney @ScottWapnerCNBC @ferrotv @WilfredFrost @SaraEisen @carlquintanilla @threadreaderapp unroll

One of the headwinds I have emphasized on @realmoney and in my interviews with @business is that company buybacks are put on hold during this EPS release period. Nearly 2/3 of S&P has a closed window now to buybacks until EPS are released. @tomkeene @jimcramer @WilfredFrost
One obvious conclusion from today's market action - we are in a new regime of volatility.
If you made this $SPY short trade I would take the profit now for +$3... and move on!
Twitter just announced a service to remove followers without notifying them. I will be busy. with that ...
I own and have been early/wrong. Buying aggressively today $T.
classic!
Ergo - long only investors rarely see a market they don't like. Not in their interest.
Interviewing long only managers does not typically give an objective market view. They are invested and beholden to a bull market - they see green and rarely see red.

Oct 11, 2021 | 12:42 PM EDT DOUG KASS Complaining About Shorts Is Always a Weak Argument! $DNA bears were gripping about Scorpion Capital alleged "front running" their DNA short analysis by purchasing puts. Well, put activity is now way down

- Friday's expiration was quite active - and Cathie Wood of ARK (ARKK) has reported that it has purchased millions of shares of DNA over the last couple of days. So, what is their rationale for the 7% decline today? Another conspiracy?? @threadreaderapp unroll

Oct 11, 2021 | 10:50 AM EDT DOUG KASS Trade of the Week - Short $SPY With Spyders ($SPY) approaching resistance (+22.90 on the day), and after a 50 handle reversal in the S&P futures from last night's low, my Trade of the Week is to short SPY (now at $439.80).

The action in the last thirty minutes is mostly irrelevant in a market now dominated by algos and machines. To say the action in the hours leading up to the last half hour is irrelevant is silly and outdated and has no empirical support. Respectfully. @ScottWapnerCNBC

@tomkeene @FerroTV My view is that banks (which I was substantially overweighted on in March 2000 and throughout the year have begun to considerably discount higher rates, improving credit quality. Buy on the rumor, sell on the news (of EPS releases).
@tomkeene A short term market headwind few are aware of - corporate buybacks disallowed and window closed to buy ahead of 3Q eps reports. @ferrotv

@ferrotv @tomkeene As Met Life's Drew Matus says on @business investors don't buy negative yielding bonds to hold to maturity. Rather they think someone will pay more... The case for equities has rested on low rates - so why are equities cheap against bonds when bonds
are a dramatically overvalued asset class? Especially given the nosebleed valuations 95-100 percentile) in stocks v. traditional metrics (to GDP, CAPE, etc.)... @threadreaderapp unroll

'Slugflation' Lies Ahead (sluggish growth, rising inflation) - a cousin to Screwflation (of the middle class) and Stagflation. All three are a toxic cocktail for equities. @tomkeene @lisaabramowicz1 @ferrotv @jimcramer @andrewrsorkin @carlquintanilla @SquawkCNBC @HalftimeReport

@tomkeene @ferrotv The support of company buybacks is often a core argument of the Bulls. But I want to remind everyone that the window for corp buybacks is now closing in front of 3Q EPS releases. Today nearly 60% of S and P companies have closed windows ahead of these reports.

Next week 75% of companies will have the window of buybacks closed. thoughts, @fundstrat? @SquawkCNBC @jimcramer @andrewrsorkin @beckyquick @lizclaman @riskreversal @carlquintanilla @terranovajoe @guyadami @threadreaderapp unroll
